content:
Posted: March 26, 2014
												Castle Crashers is one of my favorite games for when you have guests over, it is up there with smash brothers. The perfect balance of "my first rpg" with " beat em up" makes for an addictive experience. I saw it was on steam and had to get it. I did have one concern going in to the steam version, how would the couch co-op be done on the PC version? Some of you are probably laughing that I had this concern( or at my awful spelling due to my dyslexic writing habits) but keep in mind that there was a dark time before steam when PC games blew chunks, look at any PC game from 2007 to 2011. Just like how steam fixed the PC gaming market, newer games on steam are easier to use. Castle crashers supports up to four players at any time like it's console counter parts. Just for the love of gawd don't use the key bored, that is the only negative I can say about this version is that if you like games to support mouse and key bored, stay away from this game. The amazing game play, awesome visuals and stellar co-op makes this game a must own, but i will say since the price of the game is the same as the PS3 version, that is the better port. The steam version does hold up well and is a good addition to anyone's steam library. 9/10

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 26, 2015
												A classic game that really does require a controller/pad. Get together with 3 friend or power through by yourself. This game is cute, challenging and 100% funny! An absolute must have if I do say so. If you have played previous games from the makers of this game (For example; Alien Homind) you will see that they do carry on their previous ideas and even add to the game with them. You start off with 4 knights, but you unlock many more as you carry on. Each have their own spells and each level seperately and go through the story seperately. Graphics are cartoony, but they suit the game perfectly. Even if this game is old, it's still one you will continue to play and I don't ever seeing this being one of those "Games of the past" because when you do think back to it you'll end up saying "Let's just go on it for old time's sake!"Although I do recommend getting it on sale, I wouldn't have too much of an issue if I paid £9.99 for it. I got it for 90 pence during one sale and don't know how I got by without it! One thing that is worth mentioning, when you unlock new weapons and pets (There are pets with indivual buffs/talents), they unlock for all characters! So there is no real repetitive grind with this game. Truly a game you can always go back to.Should you get bored too, see if you can't button bash harder than your friends in the "All You Can Quaff" mode! Bash X and Y as fast as you can to eat as much as you can as quick as you can! Finish all the plates before your friend and gain your very own boasting rights! (Terms and conditions apply. Pain in the hand is a known side affect. All rights reserved. Don't see online for details.)This game really does speak for itself and one of my most highly reccomended games.

content:
Posted: May 28, 2014
												**AT THE TIME OF THIS REVIEW, I COMPLETED ONE PLAYTHROUGH ON NORMAL, SO SOME POINTS COULD BE MISSED**Castle Crashers, developed by indie devs The Behemoth, became famous at the release of one of the top selling games on XBLA, Castle Crashers. It was highly praised by many and lots of my friends used to play and were obsessed with the game. I wasn't much of an Xbox guy at the time, and therefore did not buy it. After four years of castle crashing, it was finally released on PC. Then, over a year later, I decided to give this game a whirl and bought it. I must tell you, I was very impressed.I'll start with the visuals. I actually enjoy the graphics in the game, taking a rather simple style. It doesn't get all artsy like Braid and Bastion, nor does it get too realistic like Crysis. It sits in the middle, and I'm happy it doesn't have graphics like that. Not all indie games need to be artsy and heavily story based platfomers or whatever. For the most part, I do like the visuals this game offers.Now, I'll move to the gameplay. This is probably the first reason Castle Crashers is so awesome. It's a beat-em-up game, so let me make this clear: THE ENEMIES ARE TOUGHER THAN THEY SEEM. Be warned when buying this if you're looking for a simple, kill-this-guy-quick kind of game. You WILL be dissappointed. The gameplay is simple, yet challenging.  I didn't discover any horribly unbalanced weapons, which makes the game even better. Bosses are usually quite easy, but there are a few notorious bosses in the game to look out for, none of which are extremely hard. One other thing this game has is an arena where you can duel it out with friends or fight groups of enemies. I love the gameplay, but not the best part to this  game.Story time, kids! I have very little to say for the story. Repetitive and cliche, but adds some unique twists to the generic "kill the wizard and save the princess" kind of style.Audio is good mostly, but could be fine tuned so there are some more individual boss themes, like most of the bosses besides the final boss. I could be incorrect, but for some of the major bosses, it was a simple theme, while others didn't even have a theme at all!Now for the best part about this game: The replayability. After you beat a short campaign (which is actually necessary in this case) then you can beat it as another character. You can unlock the 28 Animal Orbs, the 30 characters, and then beat the game with all of them, then you can go to insane mode after completion. You can also find all of the weapons to this game, play All You Can Quaff, which is a food eating game or something like that, Arena, which is simply a battle arena, and maybe help a few newbie friends or anyone in the CC community that is new or even a veteran. On average, most of my friends who play with me have usually 200 hours, and they only have one or two level 99 characters. Quite a bit of content here, so there is about 500 hours, maybe tops, if you're extremely dedicated to doing everything this game has to offer. Kind of surprising for me, even for this kind of game.Just a few flaws I want to point out: The shield is pretty clunky and is pretty difficult and annoying to use. Also, because this is a PC port, it seemed a bit rushed and only showed the buttons for an Xbox 360 controller. One other issue I found is that the multiplayer can be quite laggy, and can ruin multiplayer experiences sometimes. However, that isn't too frequent for me.Overall, Castle Crashers is an amazing game that I cannot stop playing. I highly recommend this game, and I'm always willing to play with you guys. Add me if you want to play! Graphics- 8/10Gameplay- 9/10Story- 5/10Audio- 6.5/10Replayability- 9/10.:8.0/10:.+Highly replayable+Humorous+Mostly balanced+Simple graphics+Lots of content-Clunky shield system-Multiplayer lag-Port seems "unfinished"

content:
Posted: May 19, 2013
												So. This game was released on XBLA in 2008, PS3 in 2010, and only came to us computer-type gamers in 2012. I'd heard so many good things for those four years, whenever castle crashers came up. People gushed. You know what?They were right.It's still charming. It's still fun. And it's still one of the best games to play with your friends when you're bored. Boss battles are often repetitive. Poop jokes get old. But the ridiculousness and the artistry and the hitty-hitty-whomp-kapow are all super fricken great, from the get-go and still twenty hours later. If you liked beat-em-ups back in the day-- your double dragons, your streets of rage, your golden axe-- buy this. And if you don't have friends who already own it? Buy a fourpack. Make three friends.And in the immortal words of Tatsu: "Go. Play."

content:
Posted: March 19, 2014
												It's a 4 Player medival Beat-em-up set in a comedic medival setting, let's get this out of the way, it's a port from XBLA, meaning it WILL tell you the XBOX controlls, and it WILL tell you to use a controller.The game is fun, but since there are only 2 attack buttons it gets redundant fast. Much like with borderlands 2, the story is just too repetitive and they have too many characters to play it as. I guarantee you 1 playthrough of this should be enough to quench your thirst.I'm not saying it's a bad game, the thing about it is just that the only replay value it has is with it's 3000 extra characters, but think about that, would you want to sit at your computer for hours a day as each character trying to get them to level 99? of course not.The game is good though, and it does have some minigames, but expect to lose at them.i give it a 6.5/10.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												This game is simply AMAZING.You pick a character of your liking, finish the game with him and unlock new characters + Insane mode for the character you finished the game with. You got bored repeating the story mode with your usual weapon and animal orbs? Simple, go on a quest to get them all! The Animal Orbs are helpful (and some have secret effects) which will make your playthroughs with new characters far more easier and fun!Considering weapons, there are alot to choose from. Some are hidden, some are picked up from monsters and some are just given after boss fights. There is a variety of weaponary to choose from. Also, you can get a bow and a boomerang (which is hidden and a special pet is required to get it) to boost up your combos and kill everyone with style.The story of the game is quite fun and interesting. Though I warn you the game is not that long, (about 2 hours max) but you have to keep in mind that you will be repeating it for a great amount of time if you want to unlock new characters. (Some are given when you beat arenas SOLO)My final opinion:This game is WORTH BUYING. On sale it's usually 50% or 75% off which makes it more worth the money. If you like fighting, unlocking new play methods and rewards, THIS IS THE GAME FOR YOU!

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												I remember back then when i played this game around 2009 in Xbox 360, one of my first and best indie games i have ever played. Excellent fluid gameplay that stands up to multiple playthroughs. It's filled with humor added with some blood and gore to the mix with its Beat Em Up gameplay style, level up system which adds a bit more depth to the overall gameplay experience as you can increase your stats or learn new attacks. The game also provides a great multiplayer experience with up to 4 players who can engage to the main campaign which comes in two difficulty flavors or duke it out in a arena type PvP style mode. Play as different types of characters with their own magic style, it's pretty a lot of great humor added throughout the game and Nostalgic Beat Em Up Genre and finally.. Decent plotline. Overall! It's a great Indie game Beat Em Up that contains with RPG and Action, i recommend this game for people who are interested with Beat Em Up and Hack and RPG with Action.Rated: 9.3/10

content:
Posted: July 6, 2015
												An old-school beat'em up, where you have to save princesses, by first freeing them and then getting a kiss from them. 10/10 for originality.Graphics - If you have watched any of the 90's - early 20's cartoons, you are going to fall inlove with the graphic style of this game. As a person who grew up watching cartoons, everything I see has a mixed combination of new and nostalgia.10/10Music - Boy does the music in this game have a wide variety of emotions, from the melodical and calm one that is playing while you are just moving on to the powering up it does the moment you enter a fight. Overall the place and time for every single song is perfect. 10/10Cinematics - It does have quite a few cinematics, most of them are to introduce a level or a boss, but still you won't see a one that copies the other, every single one is unique. I have to add most of them are quite funny, 10/10Story - A pretty basic story, go there, save that, get a kiss, easy as that. The but the comedical depth it adds is just tremendous. the story is mostly told through text bubbles, either way your going to see the funny side in the text or through their action. 10/10Content -  The game lacks nothing, enough enemy variations to keep yourself interested, a wide variety of weather types, random things that happen on the screen. No matter how much you play, you wont be able to predict what a person will say or do. 10/10Controls - You can play on either mouse+keyboard or controler (I recommend the controler). Both of them are fluid and responsive. 10/10Gameplay - A really fun experience, but best played with friends, even by playing alone you are punishing yourself, by what you are missing if you have 4 players and that it is really hard for 1 player. That is either the game really does get way too hard for 1 player or that I am a bad player (the second). 10/10Just the perfect game in my opinion, it gets every single thing it strives to get right, from the littlest detail to the biggest of ones. I strongly recommend playing with friends, either buy it for them (that won't happen),  make them buy it themselves (still won't happen) or buy it for your pet bear (most probable). I would like to add why the hell do you have a bear pet, but hey that is life.Overall score: 10/10

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 4, 2013
												An evil wizard steals a large, mystical gem from the king of an unnamed empire, as well as kidnapping its four princesses. The king sends the four brave knights that spearhead his guard into the vast land to rescue the princesses, recover the gem, and defeat the evil wizard. Unfortunately, the knights first have to contend with an army of barbarians storming the king's castle as the wizard makes his escape.Castle Crashers is a gem among the endless onslaught of casual games available on Steam. It has its flaws, of course, but when all the elements are considered, it makes for a fantastic, "I'm bored, let's play" sort of game that you could very well find yourself coming back to again and again.The game is a side-scrolling, linear beat-'em-up, with a silly plot, very apt character design, and great handling in terms of gameplay. When you begin, you take control of one of four knights, each with a unique elemental affiliation; the Green Knight wields deadly poison magic, the Orange Knight pyrokinetically commands fire magic, the Blue Knight freezes enemies with ice magic, and the Red Knight shocks his foes into submission with electric magic. As you progress, more characters are unlocked and thusly become playable, most of which are enemies you will face on your journey. However, replaying the game as a new character gets tiresome if done in excess. Regardless, the wide array of playable characters allows you to find one you like. I adore games that allow for this,The gameplay handles well, with a great capacity for combo attacks. Chaining melee attacks of varying strengths, ranged arrow attacks, and magic blasts aptly is the key to victory. Get surrounded, though, and constant attacks will quickly see you beaten down. Drink potions to restore health, or revive fallen comrades with first aid practices. Level up and enhance your knight in one of four fields: power, defense, agility, and magic. Find new weapons with varying properties that can either complement your knight's strengths or cover for his weaknesses. Animal orbs serve as companions and can provie passive benefits, so find as many as you can! The amount of additional goodies you can find is staggering, and it allows you to further set yourself apart amongst your group.The multiplayer mode makes this very enjoyable, and since the level-up mechanic is based on hits landed, a player playing through alone from the start would be on even grounds with a group of four playing through from the start for most of the game. Multiplayer also greatly increases your chances for survival, as potions are used automatically and players can revive fallen comrades. It's a lot more fun to play with a friend or two.The art style is adorable and hilarious, and it offers a lot of laughs. A forest filled with lovable critters that are inclined to soil themselves is not to be overlooked. There are a bunch of little things that make this game that much more charming, and that's partially why I love it so much.The game does have its flaws, though. Some of the bosses have frustrating attack methods that is countered by almost nothing. The Conehead Groom boss, for instance, can be either exploited into submission or result in you being swiftly beaten down without a chance to heal. This is also an Xbox 360 port, so the game even insists you use a controller. A keyboard is usable, but it's very awkward and sometimes more trouble than it's worth. The game can, for some, degenerate into "run forward, mash buttons, run forward again." In that case it simply may not cater to you.Those aside, I adore this game and it's always great to come back to, especially with friends.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 26, 2014
												Castle Crashers is a indie game developed by The Behemoth and is a 2D beat em up videogame that has got a minimal amount of RPG mechanics. There is minimal story and it is no reason to buy the game as it is basically just evil wizard kidnaps 4 princesses and a gem and the king sends you to save the princess's and bring the gem back. On the way you fight Barbarian's, Thieves, Trolls, A faction of knights, fire demons, pirate-ninja's and the evil wizard's minions beyond other things. The game features characters which you choose to play. You have 4 characters unlocked by default and along the way you can unlock more by completing certain stages, finishing solo arena's or finishing the game with certain characters. Many of the enemies you fight along the way can be unlocked to play as although this does not affect the enemies at all. Each character has the ability to use a melee weapon, a bow and magic. While many characters bows are just changed cosmetically and weaponry can be found and equipped instead of being character bound barring a certain character they all have magic that is unique to only a couple or even just one character. As a example the Orange knight's magic is a fire type while the Red Knight uses lightning and unlockable characters can have magic ranging from random weapons, to sawblades or nature magic. The game features a levelling in which each character is levelled seperately with a maximum level of 99. Upon levelling up each character can assign a stat point to one of the following:Strength: which increases damage dealt by the characters melee weapons.Agility: which affects the damage and speed of the bow along with the speed of the character themself.Defense: which affects the health of the character as well as his resistance to enemy attacks. Magic: which increases the damage dealt by the characters magic attacks as well as unlocking new magic moves to use.It is entirely possible to max a characters stats at around level 78 leaving 11 more levels. One thing to note is that you do NOT gain exp on kills but instead you gain exp each time you hit a enemy. You cannot juggle a dead enemy in the air for exp and neither does damage affect how much exp you get from a hit.Combat is simple in Castle Crushers with 2 melee attacks, one bow attack and up to about 3-4 different magic attacks. The game is also able to have more strategy ablied to it like the timing of juggling a enemy to keep them off the ground and unable to hit you. Standard enemies in Castle Crashers usually consist of enemies that have the same kind of moves as your knights which can include magic and bows depending on the enemy type. Most standard enemies can be juggled with enough practice which is a efficient way to deal with them. Along the way towards the evil wizard you will encounter buffed up or 'Beefy' versions of enemies who no longer consist of the move sets of you during your standard form. These enemies have got more hp than there standard versions and can be impossible to juggle sometimes. They have multiple attacks that include grabbing you and either throwing you at another player in co-op or just throwing you away during singleplayer. Then you encounter boss's which are usually signified by a HP Bar in the top center of the screen. These enemies are tough and mostly have unique attacks that are un usable by other enemies and yourself. They can also vary in there appearance with a cyclops or a giant barbarian.The items of Castle Crashers come in the forms of Bombs, Potions, Sandwichs and animal orbs. Potions are your standard fantasy potion which when used they refill your health fully. Bombs are placed on the spot you are and have a fuse. Upon detonating they will damage anything within their radius including you. Sandwichs are a special consumable which when eaten turns you into a 'Beefy' version of your character. During this state you have different attacks and can also remove obstacles that can only be removed by being in a 'beefy' form. Animal orbs are a kind of creature or animal that will follow you around and while equipped will grant you a buff ranging from stat increases, to finding food for you or even increasing the amount of exp that you earn. A animal orb stays with you until you take another animal orb with you. Upon doing that you will be able to find the animal orb in a building next to the blacksmith's frog. Animal orbs have to be unlocked by finding and equipping them.This game is mainly a co-op title with optional pvp in the arena and not so optional pvp whenever you save a princess. However the game is completely playable and finishable solo and i would still recommend it even if you have no friends that are interested or own the game. One notice of warning however is that during co-op if one person is lagging it can either cause the entire game to pause with a waiting for players notice or it can desync players which can cause players to be up to different parts of the mission and see each other doing different things. As an eample during one level me and 2 friends were fighting mobs when i started to get laggy. It seemed to pass but we got desycned which meant that while on my screen they were running around and hitting mid air while i was fighting mobs they were actually fighting the boss that was past the mobs and i was the one not contributing. A quick fix would be to just exit and re-enter the game and maybe restart the lobby.Castle Crashers has 3 gamemodes: Campaign which can be played Solo or Co-op, All you can quaff which is a gamemode where you and 3 other players/AI have to mash certain keys to quickly eat the food and whoever eats all their portion of the food first wins and finally the arena which has got multiple gamemodes in it which include standard pvp with up to 4 players and a mode where you vs each other in trying to amass the most amount of gold by digging up treasure, during this you cannot use melee, bows or magic alothough you can whack the other player by digging with the shovel underneath them. There are two other gamemodes in arena however i have not played as much arena and as such cannot remember them.This game has got a moderate amount of replayability when you first finish it if you want to unlock all the animal orbs and can have even more if you plan on unlocking all characters. However to get to level 99 is repetitive as you would have most likely finished all the area's multiple times and have gotten sick of it.Finally i would say that i definitely recommend this game if your a fan of 2d beat em up with a tiny bit of rpg meshed in and that although they recommend using a Xbox 360 controller to play i find it perfectly fine using a keyboard for it although the button prompts only being in Xbox 360 controller layout is a bit of a paint although it can be overcome.

content:
Posted: May 1, 2015
												This is a nice, fluid, beat-em-up game that is surprisingly addictive. First of all, this game focuses on combat. It only makes sense that this is what the game exceeds at. It offers classic melee combos intertwined with magical onslaughts and slick bow-shooting. As a result, the combat is never boring and keeps you eager to bash skulls all around. The other aspects of the game are pretty decent. The gameplay never lags, the story is shallow yet fun, and the cartoon-like graphics provide scenery that isn't detailed enough to distract you from the gameplay.All in all, I'd recommend it to the casual gamer who wants a little reprieve from the more strategical high-end games available.

content:
Posted: June 26, 2014
												This game is simply AMAZING.You pick a character of your liking, finish the game with him and unlock new characters + Insane mode for the character you finished the game with. You got bored repeating the story mode with your usual weapon and animal orbs? Simple, go on a quest to get them all! The Animal Orbs are helpful (and some have secret effects) which will make your playthroughs with new characters far more easier and fun!Considering weapons, there are alot to choose from. Some are hidden, some are picked up from monsters and some are just given after boss fights. There is a variety of weaponary to choose from. Also, you can get a bow and a boomerang (which is hidden and a special pet is required to get it) to boost up your combos and kill everyone with style.The story of the game is quite fun and interesting. Though I warn you the game is not that long, (about 2 hours max) but you have to keep in mind that you will be repeating it for a great amount of time if you want to unlock new characters. (Some are given when you beat arenas SOLO)My final opinion:This game is WORTH BUYING. On sale it's usually 50% or 75% off which makes it more worth the money. If you like fighting, unlocking new play methods and rewards, THIS IS THE GAME FOR YOU!

content:
Posted: September 16, 2014
												Extremely funny game, specially with multiple players to share the laughter of... pretty much everything!Everything in this game is meant to cause some chuckles, from the animations, sounds, bosses and even the storyline.The gameplay is a bit retro, 2D mash-to-win (similar to Streets of Rage), but with plenty of weapons and adorable petsto collect (Gotta Catch'em All, anyone?). There are also some basic RPG elements, like stats and level-ups, andsometimes some grinding is advised before moving to certain areas, but nothing unreasonable.The game has a lot of levels and variety, but they're pretty short and once the game is finished, there's little to doexcept the aforementioned collecting. The online modes are pretty weak, just stick to 'coop' the main game.Recommended to those looking for simple gameplay and story, and want little depth but a lot of fun in their game!

content:
Posted: January 4, 2013
												An evil wizard steals a large, mystical gem from the king of an unnamed empire, as well as kidnapping its four princesses. The king sends the four brave knights that spearhead his guard into the vast land to rescue the princesses, recover the gem, and defeat the evil wizard. Unfortunately, the knights first have to contend with an army of barbarians storming the king's castle as the wizard makes his escape.Castle Crashers is a gem among the endless onslaught of casual games available on Steam. It has its flaws, of course, but when all the elements are considered, it makes for a fantastic, "I'm bored, let's play" sort of game that you could very well find yourself coming back to again and again.The game is a side-scrolling, linear beat-'em-up, with a silly plot, very apt character design, and great handling in terms of gameplay. When you begin, you take control of one of four knights, each with a unique elemental affiliation; the Green Knight wields deadly poison magic, the Orange Knight pyrokinetically commands fire magic, the Blue Knight freezes enemies with ice magic, and the Red Knight shocks his foes into submission with electric magic. As you progress, more characters are unlocked and thusly become playable, most of which are enemies you will face on your journey. However, replaying the game as a new character gets tiresome if done in excess. Regardless, the wide array of playable characters allows you to find one you like. I adore games that allow for this,The gameplay handles well, with a great capacity for combo attacks. Chaining melee attacks of varying strengths, ranged arrow attacks, and magic blasts aptly is the key to victory. Get surrounded, though, and constant attacks will quickly see you beaten down. Drink potions to restore health, or revive fallen comrades with first aid practices. Level up and enhance your knight in one of four fields: power, defense, agility, and magic. Find new weapons with varying properties that can either complement your knight's strengths or cover for his weaknesses. Animal orbs serve as companions and can provie passive benefits, so find as many as you can! The amount of additional goodies you can find is staggering, and it allows you to further set yourself apart amongst your group.The multiplayer mode makes this very enjoyable, and since the level-up mechanic is based on hits landed, a player playing through alone from the start would be on even grounds with a group of four playing through from the start for most of the game. Multiplayer also greatly increases your chances for survival, as potions are used automatically and players can revive fallen comrades. It's a lot more fun to play with a friend or two.The art style is adorable and hilarious, and it offers a lot of laughs. A forest filled with lovable critters that are inclined to soil themselves is not to be overlooked. There are a bunch of little things that make this game that much more charming, and that's partially why I love it so much.The game does have its flaws, though. Some of the bosses have frustrating attack methods that is countered by almost nothing. The Conehead Groom boss, for instance, can be either exploited into submission or result in you being swiftly beaten down without a chance to heal. This is also an Xbox 360 port, so the game even insists you use a controller. A keyboard is usable, but it's very awkward and sometimes more trouble than it's worth. The game can, for some, degenerate into "run forward, mash buttons, run forward again." In that case it simply may not cater to you.Those aside, I adore this game and it's always great to come back to, especially with friends.

content:
Posted: March 6, 2015
												Castle Crashers is one of the best co-op games that i have played yet. This game is a button mashser so take note if you son't like that type of games. I really like the graphic style that looks like a cartoon. You start out with 4 different characters that look almost the same but are yet so different. They each have some type of magic that you can use. The blue one uses ice, the yelow one uses fire, the green one uses poision/poison gas and the red one (the one that i use) uses lightning. You can level each one of these characters up individually and everytime you level up you get some skill points that you can speend on stenght, magic power, health/defence and agility. The strenght upgrade let's you dish out more damage, the magic power will make your magic more powerfull and give you new magic tricks, the helth/defence one gives you more health and defence (duh..) and the agility one makes you faster and do more damage with your bow. The bow is one of the items that you can get others include a boomerang, a shovel, a health poition (up to 5), a super sandwich (up to five, a bomb (up to 5) and some quest items. On your quest to save the kingdom from an evil wizard you can have a flying pet following you. These pets will give you a variety of boosts like helping you level up faster, hit some of the enemies, helping you find new weapons and others. There are so many different weapons that can boost your stats or make some stats go down while the weapon is equipped like for example a weapon might give you +2 in strenght but -1 in magic. I won't spoil anything but when you beat the game the character you beat it with will unlock a new character so if you are more than on person the person who played played blue might get an alien and the person who played red might get a skeleton (i don't know what the different charaters get). I can't really mention the soundtrack and the soundeffects since i didn't have the sound on most of the time but what i heard was pretty good. When you have beaten the game and have a high level charater you will be pleased to find out that you unlocked INSANE MODE which i am curretly playing with my friend. INSANE MODE is the entire game again but much harder. Before you start insane mode you can buy some weapons and pets at a high cost but they help a lot. I forgot to mention the money. In stages you will collect money that enemies drop and these money can be spent on potions, pets, swords and other good stuff. One of the good aspects of this money system is that you don't EVER have to spend any of it. You can collect pets and swords everywhere so you don't have to buy anything. Shops are located al around the map and there is almost always a boss battle close to them. These boss battles are so good. They are really creative and can prove to be quite a challenge sometimes but not to hard. I mean like you had to fight a corncob that when you hit it turn into popcorn that give you health. There is a lot to do in this game and it is really gret but now to the parts that i didn't like so much. The game starts by saying the it is best to play with a controller and sure thats is fine but the game does not show any pc controls ANYWHERE! The controls for pc kind of suck too. Sometimes the achivemets can be such a pain to get and you need a friend to help you get them. On the topics of needing people to play with this game is nowhere nears as fun playing alone as it is playing with someone else. I tried alone for a while and it was not very fun at all so if you don't have anyone to play with then DON'T buy this game, but if you have someone to play with i defintly think that you should buy this game. To be honest this is an amazing game when playing with you friends. The game is so creative and fun and there are so many sword and pets and charaters because you can get more charaters from arenas and  beating the game with new charaters gives you more characters. The graphics are really cool and the gameplay is also really fun. The controls can be a bit stupid at times but it can be overlooked if you have gotten used to them. If you can play with someone else this game is a 9/10 because it is so fun and creative and all the stuff you can do even after beating the game it has high replay value. If you have someone to play with BUY THIS GAME! However if you don't have anyoe to play with the game becomes so much less fun. Alone it is one long grind (if you want to complete it) or just a game you will only beat once and then thats it. Alone i would give it a 6/10 because it is still a great game in my opinion but i would say DON'T BUY THIS GAME IF YOU ARE ALONE! I hope this review was useful. It was my first so i would love critisism. Thank you:-)

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 6, 2015
												An old-school beat'em up, where you have to save princesses, by first freeing them and then getting a kiss from them. 10/10 for originality.Graphics - If you have watched any of the 90's - early 20's cartoons, you are going to fall inlove with the graphic style of this game. As a person who grew up watching cartoons, everything I see has a mixed combination of new and nostalgia.10/10Music - Boy does the music in this game have a wide variety of emotions, from the melodical and calm one that is playing while you are just moving on to the powering up it does the moment you enter a fight. Overall the place and time for every single song is perfect. 10/10Cinematics - It does have quite a few cinematics, most of them are to introduce a level or a boss, but still you won't see a one that copies the other, every single one is unique. I have to add most of them are quite funny, 10/10Story - A pretty basic story, go there, save that, get a kiss, easy as that. The but the comedical depth it adds is just tremendous. the story is mostly told through text bubbles, either way your going to see the funny side in the text or through their action. 10/10Content -  The game lacks nothing, enough enemy variations to keep yourself interested, a wide variety of weather types, random things that happen on the screen. No matter how much you play, you wont be able to predict what a person will say or do. 10/10Controls - You can play on either mouse+keyboard or controler (I recommend the controler). Both of them are fluid and responsive. 10/10Gameplay - A really fun experience, but best played with friends, even by playing alone you are punishing yourself, by what you are missing if you have 4 players and that it is really hard for 1 player. That is either the game really does get way too hard for 1 player or that I am a bad player (the second). 10/10Just the perfect game in my opinion, it gets every single thing it strives to get right, from the littlest detail to the biggest of ones. I strongly recommend playing with friends, either buy it for them (that won't happen),  make them buy it themselves (still won't happen) or buy it for your pet bear (most probable). I would like to add why the hell do you have a bear pet, but hey that is life.Overall score: 10/10

content:
Posted: June 23, 2015
												This game is an outstanding game, I recommend everyone to purchase the game. It is worth the $15, I'd even say it's worth $30! This game is fun to play over and over, and I find it to get old sometimes. But I still find it fun when I get back to the game. Try it! I know you'll like it if you try it out. This game is a very good game and fun to experience over and over, especially with friends. If you have some friends to play with, it'll be a very very fun game. I purchased this game for my cousin and I to play together, and I found us playing it a lot together. We are even going to complete the game on Insane mode (A harder difficulty unlocked after completing the entire game). Well I recommend you people who are reading this review to pick up the game yourself. You'll enjoy it if you want a cool adventure, although the graphics can be bad... I think that it is still outstanding in performance! :P The game can be glitchy at times, like my cousin is playing one level at the same time I played another. So we were basically in the same game, but in different levels? I don't understand how this glitch can occur, but it can be resolved if both players exit the game, wait a few minutes, then start up the game and get back together. This game is worth all the money, and I believe whoever reads this review will have the urge to purchase the game themself. The game is a very good game, I own it on Steam and on the PS3. And if you saw my playtime on the PS3 version, I believe it would say 600 hours. I did get all my characters to level 99... This game is a blast! Try it out right now! You definately will enjoy all of the fantastic levels that the game has to offer!

content:
Posted: August 7, 2015
												Castle Crashers is one of the simplest games but it's so much fun.You attack by constantly mashing buttons which is encouraged rather than looked down upon. There are also combos you level up to learn that you can master and even though they do help greatly, even the best of players usually resort to mashing. Vertical alignment can usually be pretty annoying given the perspective, but a quick magic jump or bomb and you're good.Mashing is usually the worst possible tactic in Back Off Barbarian though.Straight outta Tom Fulp, Castle Crashers has all the Newgrounds humor you could ever want and more. This game shines in multiplayer, where you gang up on literally everything and go to town with your buds (or just play volleyball with some sand dudes.)

content:
Posted: July 8, 2016
												This is one of the most awesome games I've ever played. The graphics are amazing with a unigue design and a great style. This game is really fun to play alone or with friends, and is filled with challenging bosses and enemies. It has loads of playable characters from the derpy villager to the Harcore necromancer, as well as tons of weapons with different buffs and debuffs. It's filled with content, and you can play the game over and over again without getting bored, or jump into insane mode. The level design is on point, and the soundtrack is done very well. There's even a pvp or boardgame option if you're that kind of person.The only things I don't like are the frankly immachure humor, and the part in some levels where you kiss the princess. Other than that, this is an amazing game that is definitely worth the $15. I'd rate 9.5/10.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25
												Castle Crashers is a very fun single player or co-op experience similar to the good 'ol days Double Dragon and Streets of Rage beatem up style games but with its own unique story line and humor as well as a robust leveling system, weapon upgrades (tiered by lv) and pet boosts.  There is also tons of replayability here and there are secrets all over the map once you have unlocked certain things in the story so the fun is not even close to being done once you beat the story mode.  You can also unlock 20+ characters to play and level up as which also keeps it fun and fresh!The game has been around for quite a while and has had quite the support as well as new stuff added to it over the years.  I originally purchased this on my Xbox 360 when it came out and played it quite a bit.  I re-purchased it on Steam to complete my collection and have had just as much fun if not more fun as I did when it was brand new.If you like beatum up style games with a bit of leveling and weapon progression as well as a funny story, this game is for you.  I recommend it for sure!  Its even more fun with a group of three of your friends as you fight over sharing money while arguing over who should unlock the weapon or pet first and in which order everyone will get it!  Fun times indeed!

content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												A great hack-and-slash coop! You can join up with 3 friends in local and online coop and rain hell on your enemies with 4 powers, strength, magic, defense, and agility! There's a load of unlockable characters that keep you playing, the game is tons of fun alone or with friends, and its got plenty of replay value to it. Simple, casual gameplay that is rarely frustrating, and a great port for a console. The only downside is the controls without a console controller, but you can always remap them as you'd want in the settings. The younger me will never forget hours of this on Xbox Live.

content:
Posted: January 1, 2013
												The art style is quirky and fun and in a way, beautiful. I like it. The humor of The Behemoth is also something to enjoy, like the pooping owl and the small boss that gets replaced by a bigger boss--not to mention the hilarious unveiling of a certain princess. It took 13 hours for me to complete the game, which is on the longer side. It usually only takes 5 hours (according to what I've seen posted) to complete the game. CC has tons of replayability with so many characters and insane mode, but I'm just not one for doing the same levels over again. All in all, I'd give it 8/10, and say it's worth playing at least once.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 27, 2014
												I've only played this a few hours so far, but I must recommend this to any fans of old school beat 'em up / hack and slash games.  While I haven't seen it bring anything particulary new to the table in my play thus far.  It does deliver a very solid performance for the genre.  Already in my play I have seen little nods to classics like Golden Axe and Battletoads that made me smile.  The art work is colorful and crisp and really pops.  The enemies vary as you go along to mix things up a little bit.  It is also rife with cheezy little humourous moments that will make you chuckle.One other neat thing is that you can find different weapons and pets throughout your play.  So you are not just stuck with the same stuff the whole time.  Also, as you play you level up your character and gain new combos along the way.  So there is some progression to the game play.I really can't find anything negative to say about it thus far, except for maybe the fact that if you want to change pets/weapon you have to go back to your home castle and it can take a moment to navigate the map back to where you were, but it is a minor inconvieniance at most.I picked this game up for DIRT CHEAP during the Summer Sale and it is absolutely worth every penny.  Best beat 'em up I've played on PC since Little Fighter.

												Castle Crasher just as funny as Battle block theater!What is it about?-In CC you are a Knight(maybe along with some freinds) in the middle of a war and all the beatiful princesses have been captured, your job is to go around kicking the big bad bosses butts...and win, then make out with the princesses :) (cha ching) :)How do I beat the bosses?-Around the little world you can find shop's and in those shops you can buy better sword's and uprgrade your Charactor-In some shops you can buy pets!What do I need a pet for?-Pets are there to follow you around and buff you up-buffs can range from extra health too pooping out GOLD bar's!My opinion...-This game was very fun too play (I like middevil stuff so you know) I do how ever wish that we had that annoyingly hilarious comentater from battle block theater though but whatever.-I do how ever like the fact that you have a secondary power up.Be sure to Follow Me...and my freinds for more reviews and game play!Have a good one Guy's!

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 8, 2015
												This is one of the best games I've ever played.Pros:+ Local game capability and online coop, up to 4 people.+ A lot of unlockable stuff.+ Diversity between knights.+ Humor across the game.+ Cheap to buy.+ Bosses are puzzly, some of them are very easy to defeat if you find their weak spot.+ A lot of unlockables. Some are really hard to find.Cons:- Becomes repetitive after some time, there are over 30 playable characters that you unlock and the only difference between them is the magic spells. Once you beat the game once you can beat it any time.- Not the type of game you play online, but rather the one you play alone or with friends. Doesn't stop you from playing with strangers though.- Has a lot of grinding involved, the experience system is really bad overall.- Some playable content is pay-to-use DLC, but the items they provide are only worth using for the first 15 levels at most.In short, it's definitely a very good game you should try with friends. You will have a good time but don't expect to spend 2000 hours on it.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2016
												A great hack-and-slash coop! You can join up with 3 friends in local and online coop and rain hell on your enemies with 4 powers, strength, magic, defense, and agility! There's a load of unlockable characters that keep you playing, the game is tons of fun alone or with friends, and its got plenty of replay value to it. Simple, casual gameplay that is rarely frustrating, and a great port for a console. The only downside is the controls without a console controller, but you can always remap them as you'd want in the settings. The younger me will never forget hours of this on Xbox Live.

content:
Posted: June 25, 2014
												So far, one of the best hack'n'slash RPG's I have played. It is fun both single player, and multiplayer. If you can, I would play multiplayer with friends, or even just randoms. If not, then single player is just as good. However, It is lacking that bit of competitive spirit in between you and your teammates. The fighting system is solid, and fair (No PVP stunlocks here folks!) and it can be great fun playing the multiple game modes with others. Also, if you can't play online for whatever reason (Like me 99 percent of the time) but you have friends around that want to play, you can do local multiplayer for all game modes. Even all you can quaff. Ohhhhhhhhhh my thumbs...Overall, I would say to buy this game. It runs on fairly low end computers, and you will probably enjoy your time with this game. Pink knight is the best.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2015
												Please play this game with a controller please.Castle Crashers is an honestly silly game involving you, maybe three other friends, and sharp objects with which to stab other things with. Each colored knight has this ability which corralates to its color; in a sort of elemental attack or so.Its a fun and zany stab-em-up game with a penchant for mob-based mechanics which in my opinion, is the best and most fun way to do it. The best feeling is when you throw a dude into a bunch of other dudes.The art style is cute, but its unknown to me if its trying to be funny. I laughed anyway.My only real complaint is its rather easy to ram bosses into a corner and keep right on hitting them, and they can't do a darn thing as they're much too busy recoiling from my hits. Bosses are easy to cheese, is what I'm saying.Play it with friends if you can. I got four USB hookups. Let's do this. The green one is my favorite because poison.9/10

content:
Posted: April 4
												Fun gameplay inspired by classic side scrolling beat em ups. There are a variety of characters to choose from, various weapons with different stats, leveling up and choosing what to focus on, magic, items. It's really fun, especially with a friend. It's got a sense of humor and good game play. Interesting boss battles, and a wide variety of levels. My one and only complaint is a complaint I tend to have with all 2D side scrolling beat em ups, is that it can be hard to tell where to hit. If you're standing slightly in front of the enemy, or behind, you miss, and it can be tough to judge. Maybe I just suck though?

content:
Posted: October 7, 2014
												It's Castle Crashers... seriously? Where have you been living the past 5 years if you aren't even remotely aware of this title by now?This game basically has a perfect mix of brawler and RPG elements with optional 4 player co-op. Plenty of secrets to find and gear to collect. Juvenile humor is abound and plentiful. Great soundtrack as well. Brought to you from the artists over at Newgrounds.com.My only  real complaint about the game is that there are way too many characters to unlock and the amount of content is limited... too many clones of characters, not enough diversity, makes the game a bit stale over time. By the third playthrough it gets pretty obnoxious having to repeat the entire game over again instead of just allowing you to select your favorite stages.I wish they would of added more levels or an extra mode that allows you to unlock / level your characters without having to replay the entire story line over again. I mean once or twice is enough... you can't really skip cut scenes either which adds to the annoyance factor. Other than that, it's a great game to play with some friends.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2016
												Played it for many hours at first on Xbox 360 and some time after, at some sale, started to play it again on PC. I can say for sure that Castle Crashers is one of most interesting beat 'em up games I have ever played. Graphics might look like some kind of game for kind but don't be mistaken - kids, teenagers, adults, everyone will have great time playing this game. With so many characters (few at start, many to unlock) to play, so many levels to make, many weapons and secrets to find, you won't be bored after beating once, or twice, or until you will reach max level with every character. You can enjoy it alone, or with friends on 1 PC or over internet. Castle Crashers isn't not only filled with action, but also with humour, and what's better, the one that will for sure make you laught, unless you take everything too serious. Sure, some people will say it get's boring quickly or it's repetitive but if you ask me, I didn't get bored even once in those 50 (at the moment I'm making this review) hours. And I'm sure I will play it at some point again, and again, and again... and again. It's really easy to get addicted to this game.In my opinion, it's worth full price but sure, there are people who might not know what Castle Crashers is, or what kind of people made this game. If you are fan of beat 'em up games, then you must grab it at sale. Look at the number of reviews this game have received, and look at what number of those are positives ones - there is high chance that another positive review will be coming from you.

content:
Posted: December 29, 2016
nukes-viewHi all, nukes here.Castle Crashers is a 2D side scrolling hack and slash adventure. Easy to pick up and play, I enjoyed playing this game solo and online with friends (up to 4 players).This game is very well put together and the developers have a knack for 2D side scrolling games. Great humour and art styles with a variety of musical artists creating great music for each level.The Game PlaySimple side scrolling game (works best with a controller)with great combo's and intuitive magic system. Simple levelling system and many different characters you can unlock, items you can find and pets you can make love you.DifficultyThe difficulty is pretty straight forward but not restricting there is a harder difficulty that you can unlock after completion, which can be found on the map after the first boss. Can only be done with same character.Controls & InterfaceGeared towards playing with a controller but not limited, as keyboard can work just as well.I just found it much easier with controller.AchievementsThis game has simple and fun achievements that are relatively easy to get and nothing that you would lose sleep over.StoryYou play a knight out to save the princess's and to defeat a dark evil wizard, on your journey you will encounter many hardships. Be brave young knight.Combat System The combat system is simple and fun revolving around a hack slash method with great combos that are given to you along your journey through levelling up.Magic spells are also learnt in the same way which can sway the battle in your favour.Pet companions can also be found throughout, used to give your character unique perks or advantages in battle that can help on your quest.Got to love RammyLevelingSimple levelling system that lets you place points into four attributes that increase your characters stats.The magic spells, can be quite different per character and all have great uses. Try out different characters to find the spells that suit you. Sounds & EffectsThe music for this game was composed by a variety of different artists and I found some of the music to be great and even downloaded a few of them myself from NewGrounds[www.newgrounds.com]for freeFavourite has to be this one but it isn't listed in the list.GraphicsThe graphics are simplistic but I found them very pleasing and suiting to the game. Cut ScenesI found the cut scenes well thought-out and funny, got to love the ending of the cyclops.Humour & TriviaI loved the humour of this game it is brilliant and suited for all ages and retains the same style throughout.MultiplayerThis game has a fantastic multiplayer that lets you play co operatively with friends either locally or online. Castle Crashers offers a small range of fun multiplayer modes where you can go up against friends in a fighting, feeding frenzy and good old volley ball real man's game.Bugs - ImportantNo bugs or issues were found.ConclusionI loved Castle Crashers and would happily go back to it if my friends asked, overall fun and great entertainment for all ages.Great to play with guests or friends at home.Easy to pick up and play and then just walk away if needed.I would say the only downside to this game is, that lately the online community has dwindled, best to play with friends.I will be keeping a close eye on the developers to see if they have any future releases planned as I really do like their style of games.Hope I helped.ηυĸєΜ266

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 15, 2015
THIS REVIEW IS ABOUT CONTENT FROM BEFORE THE REMASTERED PATCH!Do I reccomend Castle Crashers? Yes.Do I reccomend you buy the title on Steam? No.Castle Crashers is an Arcade-Style Side-Scrolling Beat 'Em Up with a level-up system, unique playable characters and loads of weapons!Where this game succeeds is in its focus around cooperative play, but can still be played to its completion alone. Behemoth's "Game 2" has brought fun times to players for almost 7 years now.So what are the good qualities of this game?1-4 player cooperative story mode sure to pack laughter and anger in one box2-4 player pvp arena modeAmazing soundtrack that will make you want to play levels over just to hear themBehemoth's signature cartoony yet brutal gameplayACTION! COMEDY! ROMANCE!Over 80 weapons to tweak your stats outside of the level-up systemNow, this game is great and a must have, just not on Steam.If you don't have one or more friend(s) who are willing to play this whenever you are, this game will get really old really fastTerrible, and I mean TERRIBLE online multiplayer. Whether you're playing with somebody across the country or across the room, 95 times out of 100 there will be unbearable periods of lag on one or more players' ends, causing all players to see different screens. Some examples may be that a player is standing still, using their W key attack, while another player is seeing them using their W key reviving another player. On one screen you may see your teammate dead on the ground, while they are actually fighting something you may not even see!Button prompts are displayed as X-Box buttons. Leaving players who didn't read and memorize the chart on the main menu often clueless on what to pressIf you're not playing together on the same machine, don't play together at allSo all in all, I do reccomend Castle Crashers to players. I myself picked this up for 70 cents on the last Steam Summer Sale, having no idea of the lagfest I was getting myself into. Only buy this on Steam if you plan to play by yourself a lot.I suggest you pick up this title up on another platform. Either the X-Box Live Arcade or the PlayStation Store.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 10, 2014
												The game is fun - especially with friends! So don't think I don't like this game. It's got a hefty amount of clever jokes that aren't too far shoved in your face (like I noticed Ceiling Cat watching me from above in the pet store). But the controls for this game are... to put it gently... relatively poor.It recommends an Xbox controller, but it's a PC game so it should assume the majority of people will play it using a mouse and keyboard. It translates it's controls as though you're using an Xbox controller first off - something that was a really bad sign to me at first - but the real thing that crimps the controls is the fact you have to hold some buttons and tap others to activate this or that action. Your starting spell for instance is simply "Hold Shift, press Strong-Attack" while the bolt version of it would be "Hold Shift, Press Use-Item". Even then to cast spells in the air you have to use different buttons (Strong-Attack or Use-Item) to decide if you shoot horizontally or downwards which is just feels off (why not just let the movement keys press the direction you want to aim?). The fact that you can't even seperate the Item, magic, and the melee commands makes it bug♥♥♥♥ disorienting. It's a keyboard: It has enough buttons to cover the actions without having to resort to playing Twister with your fingers.That said I can't say I've played it and not had a blast yet. Granted I've only been playing it a couple of days so far. It's by no means an easy game, but it's a fun one.

content:
Posted: October 7, 2014
												It's Castle Crashers... seriously? Where have you been living the past 5 years if you aren't even remotely aware of this title by now?This game basically has a perfect mix of brawler and RPG elements with optional 4 player co-op. Plenty of secrets to find and gear to collect. Juvenile humor is abound and plentiful. Great soundtrack as well. Brought to you from the artists over at Newgrounds.com.My only  real complaint about the game is that there are way too many characters to unlock and the amount of content is limited... too many clones of characters, not enough diversity, makes the game a bit stale over time. By the third playthrough it gets pretty obnoxious having to repeat the entire game over again instead of just allowing you to select your favorite stages.I wish they would of added more levels or an extra mode that allows you to unlock / level your characters without having to replay the entire story line over again. I mean once or twice is enough... you can't really skip cut scenes either which adds to the annoyance factor. Other than that, it's a great game to play with some friends.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2013
												I am so glad that this game was on sale. Because if it weren't for the sale I wouldn't be able to come across with such an enjoyable game. It has both humor and action in it. Not to mention the awesome combat style. What I observed in this game, however, it tries to put you to a class like ''take this stick, increase your intelligence and be a mage!'' but being a mage is not really powerful in the game. You end up using your ''stick'' in melee combat and go with it. There could be more options if only the game allowed it, such as being an archer if there were more types of bows. But then again these do not change the enjoyment of the game. I do not yet had the time to play it with my friends but I'm sure that it'd be even more fun like it is possible. And you can have cute pets with nice perks!All in all I just cannot stop playing this game. Both for the funny storyline and the great combat style.

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 31, 2014
												Great fun game for the whole family, or just good 4 player sidecroller to mash enemies with your friends. TONS of unlockable characters, and a relatively easy achievement list to 100% if you are an achievement hunter. The DLC packs are cheap and totally great adding two extra Characters, The Blacksmith and The Pink Knight.Insanity mode after game completion offers a new difficulty to play through increasing the amount of playability and extending the level grinding to a more enjoyable and challenging setting. The artwork is great as well. It is very colorful and family friendly. The Game is playable by all ages (with a few poop and fart jokes in the mix).I also like that with my Xbox 360 Wireless Receiver for Windows I am able to hook up more than one controller and allow more than 1 player/controller to be supported by a single USB port and play/level multiple characters at once as my friends can choose my other characters and level along with me.Also available on the Playstation Network and Xbox Market. I would certainly recommend this game to anyone and everyone. Loads of enjoyment, replayability, and good laughs.10/10

content:
Posted: October 7, 2013
												An extremely fun side scrolling, beat'em up, co-op rpg.  While it is nothing that  we haven't all seen before,  Castle Crashers executes all aspects of this  type of game perfectly.   Each character, do to color coordination, is easily identifiable.  Unique special abilities help each player  stand apart, as well as weapon choices, secondary items and companions that add passive abilities and stats.There is an rpg aspect that allows each player to upgrade his or her character's stats separately from the rest.  The enemies are well balanced as well as each type possessing its own attacks and abilities.  Almost every level has a boss at the end.Similar to Diablo, you can play back through after completion for a greater challenge.  I recommend having 4 players when you do this; otherwise, the game might begin to feel off balance.The game as a whole offers solid game play, good re-playability, fun co-op and many laughs.  A good buy if you plan on playing with a group of friends.Note: there  is a bit of lag when using the keyboard; the game is built around the game pad.


Castle Crashers 
A Screenshot of Castle Crashers
By: Vash(88)

												Pros: Great replayability. Really fun to play with friends. Good singleplayer. Great humor. Posted: August 12, 2014
												A classic from The Behemoth that is just so good, people defecate before you character can even swing his/her weapon. Another non biased review despite my enjoyment of The Behemoth game. I re-bought this game after I completed it on my Ps3 and it was just as good... with the exception of volleyball replacing that horrid button-masher "All You Can Queef(af)" not included on the Steam version. The gameplay is sort of rough around the edges but is still a pretty good contribution to the beat-em-up genre. The game is also 4-player co-op fun that could be played on one computer/system or online (something that is lacking in the game community now a days pertaining to local co-op). It's a pretty fun game and it's only flaws are the occasional bugs and some online issues. It's an indie game on top of the second game this company has pushed out so don't get all in your feelings if you lag out of a game. It's really good quality for a game that came out in 2008 and sort-of remastered in 2010. CC is also very addicting because if your like me and want to unlock all the characters then your going to have to playthrough like no other game. You may be sick of repeating the game on top of playing the newly unlock insane mode for even more characters but it will be worth it in the end (maybe not). CC is an all around fun game brought to you by Newgrounds and I'd just wish the son from Dad n' Me and the troll were characters.  An all around good time with your friends and an awesome indie expirience. This game is 9.99/10 (Those bugs can get annoying). *On a side note you should also check out BattleBlock Theater (Steam Version of course) and Alien Hominid (On Console Only)*

Posted: November 30, 2016
												From my experience playing as Green -> Gray, I can tell this game is all the types of awesome combined into one legendary package with sandwiches and knights.So we have our basic Knights, Red Knight aka Darth Sidious. We have Blue Knight aka Phantom Blood Dio, Green Knight or Diarrhea Knight and Orange Knight.You can choose these 4 knights at the start of the game and by completing the game with a certain knight, Beating a certain level to get Gray Knight or the Alien Hominid, or by spending a few minutes in the Arena.I won't get too into the story but the knights party in the barracks behind/underneath the Throne Room, A gray knight gets dead and gets thrown into the party, Everyone stops and gets triggered, Kills some Barbarians and then the princesses get captured...All 4 of them...If you're playing with friends, When you get to saving the Orange Princess and it starts to be a duel for her hand, Let him win. Just...Let him win. Trust me, You'll thank me soon.The Game features 3 Modes. Story Mode (Castle Crashers) and 2 Minigames, Arena and Back-Off Barbarian, Which can be a bit confusing for new players but with a bit of practice, It's easy.Obviously, You can play the modes alone like the lil' basement-dwelling troll you are OR with the friends you have, Mr. Popular.The Animal Orbs are like unlockable passive perks that you can only have one of them. You can buy them or find them.The Weapons you can get can change the stats you have. For Example, The starting weapon Stoveface the Black Knight you can unlock by beating the game with Gray starts with a Gladiator Sword which gives some Attack and Defence but reduces Magic Attacks and has a chance to do a Critical Hit (In my experience of TF2, Is a bad thing for them and a good thing for you.)The Bosses are well done and challening as with the enemies...Except for the Fire Demon, It's evil.Everytime you Level Up, You get 2 skillpoints until 30+ or so where you get only 1. Which is pretty amazing since a 2D-Hack and Slash Beat 'em Up has RPG elements in it too.You can replay it many times you want, There will always be a new playstyle and character waiting for you until you unlock all the elementals.The DLCs (Both Blacksmith and Pink Knight.) Adds 2 more elemental magic and 10 more weapons, So if you're bored, You can always spend a couple of bucks or two.Thats it for the Pros, Let me get to the Cons.It takes too much time to unlock every single thing but none of use here are Completionists anyway, Right?And some bosses require grinding to level up so Speedrunning will be tough.PS : Stoveface-senpai is bae.

Posted: June 23, 2014
												Originally played this game on 360 years ago and was surprised when it showed up on steam. I played the absolute♥♥♥♥♥♥out of CC, getting several level 99 characters and I must've completed the game 20+ times with my friends. Multiplayer is phenomenal fun and would be one of the main reasons to get this. That's not to say that single player isn't also amazingly fun; a TONN of collectables throughout the game but none that convolutedly hard to come across, weapons, pets, characters and a few others make this game have a ton of replayablity. Most of the time you'll find yourself using melee but the magic is pretty dang powerful as well and works very well in combination of melee attacks, the archery on the other hand isn't that fantastic but it does prove it's worth in the game (sometimes).The story, though it is fairly simple (just saving princesses and defeating bosses/enemies), you'll be laughing the entire way through, the art style works incredibly well for this level of humor and makes everything more enjoyable to look at. On sale or full price, this game is worth every penny.

Posted: June 22, 2015
												Pros Castle Crashers is a 4 player, local beat em up brawler and is the game most people think of when they play brawlers. i have played Castle Crashers on both PC and Xbox. I rate the game very highly and it is the best of its genre of 4 player brawlers. this game is a great game to play by yourself but it is much more fun with friends and you can meet good people on servers of this game. the game has 2 difficulty modes normal and insane mode, and insane mode is very challenging. If you think hard isn't hard enough you can play the game without spending any level up points making it more challenging and this game is very fun when you set your own goals. the game is full of content with tons of weapons, characters, pets, and other unlock-ables to make the game worth replaying multiple times. the graphics on this game are great, it looks like a beautiful flash game and this version has great options for its sound, display, controls, rebind-able keys, and it has excellent controller support. if you on other games owned by the same company you unlock a playable character in that game example if you own battle block theater you can unlock hatty hattington. Cons The game is kinda short but its not a big problem because its replayable but still, you will get sick of playing the same levels so many times new levels would have fixed this problem  Leveling up to 99 takes too long, previously there were tricks to level up like the boomerang glitch, the 256 glitch, and other tricks but they have been patched and that HUGELY take away from the game, when i had played castle crashers on the xbox 360 the boomerang glitch was partly patched where the exp rewarding glitch would only work in the industrial castle and that made it easier to level up you could really level up fast if you did the trick with insane mode on but sadly that has been patched. in my opinion patching games are really good, game breaking bugs need to be fixed obviously, i had no problem with the 256 glitch being removed, making the boomerang glitch work on only one boss was alright, but i think that taking out makes leveling up stupidly long without out of game cheats. A few of characters use the same ability's example the grey knight and the cone head knight have the exact same magic ability's, and you need to beat the glitch specific characters to unlock other ones. ConclusionOverall its worth it and really enjoyable to play but the level up system needs at least a few more easy ways to level up it takes quite a long time to level up making the game very hard to fully complete. i would recommend a console version over the PC version because the level up system is simply better. i also recommend all the DLC it is worthwhile to pay for the new content, the pink knight DLC is worthwhile and the purple knight DLC is not as interesting as the pink knight DLC mainly because of one weapon (put simply because the broccoli sword is the best starting weapon), but still worth it. Castle Crashers is a must have in my opinion, worth every cent and is the definitive game of its genre.

												This game is awesome! It has a great sense of humor, though things are still epic and serious. There are many characters to unlock which is always a good thing, and the pets are adorable (well, some of them, anyway o.o). Posted: December 24, 2013
												Okay, Pros: Co-op, arcade style, fun with friends, fairly good animation, several different types of enemies, think outside the box art style, epic music, uniqe and old school style boss fights, and beleive it or not REALLY good story. Two more additional things, Behemoth, and I think Battle Block Theater should be on steam.Cons: CONTROLLER OR DIE, playing without friends is boring, difficult playing alone.Overall: Buy the game when its full price. If you have a friend (or a few) that want to play too, buy a copy for each of them too. Endless hilarity insues amongst your friends, the game itself, and soon you will be cackling over the micrphone about the endless laughs and enjoyment this game will bring to your life. End note: I wasn't kidding about "CONTROLLER OR DIE" if you want to NOT be confused by the game's UI, get a WIRED Xbox 360 controller. Trust me, it'll boost your gameplay experience by about hmmmm: 25%-60-ish%.

Posted: January 12, 2015
												8.5/10A very fun hack and slash from Tom Fulp, creator of Newgrounds. One of the best hack and slash games around with a wonderful art style, a great sound track, and tons of unlockables. The replay value is through the roof as you'll constantly be telling yourself "ok, just one more game". There are 2 pieces of DLC for $.99 each that are unnecessary to the game play unless you are a completeist and want everything just for the sake of having it. The money from the DLC does go 100% to charity so there is that but, I wouldn't bother unless playing a pink character or having horns is incredibly important to you.The game is cheap as it is, especially considering the many hours of play time you'll potentially get out of it but, as with anything that's been on Steam for any significant length of time, I would add it to my wishlist and wait for a decent sale. And like I said, don't feel pressured into buying the DLC as it doesn't add anything of great value to the game (i.e., levels, more story etc.). It's mostly cosmetic with a few weapons that won't make the game any more or less easy for you as you won't be able to use them until you hit the appropriate levels anyways.

Posted: August 10, 2015
												Castle Crashers is a competitive co-op beat-em-up by the minds behind Alien Hominid. You and three friends travel throughout the kingdom ruining lives and crashing castles on your stubborn quest to save the princesses. There are tons of landscapes to traverse, weapons and characters to unlock, and princesses to kiss. You can even gain experience and level up your chosen knight. This has to be the best beat-em-up I've played in a long time, even coming close to beating Scott Pilgrim as my favorite. A great time alone, and even better with friends, Castle Crashers isn't getting outta here without a recommendation.

Posted: April 19, 2015
												Absolutely designed to be played with a controller.  Before purchasing, make sure you have some sort of controller support.  Also I will say that this game is best played with friends or online.  Although I have played it a ton without anyone else, so it is possible.Beyond that, it is a great game.  First played this game on the Xbox 360 and remembered how much fun I had so when I saw it again on Steam, I knew I had to buy it.  Every area in the game is repetitive, but they make up for this by adding in tons of different weapons and animal orbs to collect.  This adds some desire to replay the game multiple times in order to either experience everything or simply do a bit of collecting (took me until my second playthrough to find the dang boomerang).  You start out being able to choose from four different characters, but just like the weapons and animal orbs, there are many other characters to unlock as you play through the game.  Some require you to beat the game with certain characters, and some simply require you to do certain things or progress to certain parts of the game.All of this combined adds replayablility to the game and definately makes this purchase worth every penny.

Colourful, cartoonish environment, interesting and funny combos, weapons, enemies, bosses, power ups and mini games and many hours of fun with your mates. All these with 2,99 € only! I love this game and you will love it too no matter what!!!! :D
