Posted: January 10, 2016
												The game has all of the original version and multiplayer feature allows you to play with friends all around the world. The game sets it up so that is's fun to play a level again and again. The bosses are memorable and exiting. You can play local or over wi-fi. You can use a Xbox controller, witch really makes the game more exiting. There is a lot of playable characters to unlock, there is also a lot of collectibles, such as weapons and sidekicks. You can only complete the game by replaying it more times and it is totally woth it. You will spend a lot of fun hours playing this game. I would recomed this game for gamers or casuals who like classic NES games or if you liked battel block theater (but they are totaly different). I wuld give it 4 of 5 stars.

Posted: July 6, 2015
												Let's start this review with a simple pro's and con's list,PROS:-Art style is colourful.-Gameplay is not hard to understand and is fun.-Controller support!CONS: -If you're using a keyboard, the prompts are for controllers mostly so you'll have to learn the controls via menus.-Not a great story, but the gameplay does slightly make up for it,Overall, I think that Castle Crashers is a great overall game, good gameplay and a good (enough) story to enjoy for multiple hours. Full controller support is definately a plus and will help you play the game to it's fullest. If you enjoy side-scrolling adventure games with a great art style you'll really enjoy Castle Crashers.

Posted: June 18, 2015
												Great game! Only problem I have with it is that it is very, very, boring if you don't have a friend to play co-op with you. And I hate it when people say "this online community is dead" yet when I open up a public lobby it becomes full in a matter of seconds, and yes you can button mash through the game, but that doesn't take away from the fun! I mean.. comeon who doesn't like the usual fairy tail; save the princess{s} and defeat the evil wizard plot/scenario. (there isn't a "story" but you can follow along the actions of the characters, for example the princesses are being dragged away, stuff like that) I also have one more complaint: Sometimes in a lobby with my friends, and in game the game will just freeze up and that is a problem for me seeing as my computer has an i7 4th gen processor and a 690 in it.  I'm positive it isn't my internet because it doesn't happen on other games! It always fixes though, it isn't gamebreaking at all. Another thing, some reviews might say you NEED a controller for the game but that isn't true at all! None of my friends, including myself, don't use our XBOX360 controllers in the game. Yes, the game is a completely unchanged port from the XBOX360, but I mean comeon why does it matter if it says "press x or y to attack" etc., you can litterally press ESC and go into the controls, click keyboard and mouse, and change (or leave) the controls to your liking. What is keeping me into the game is the characters, pets, and weapons. You can unlock 31 characters, 79 unlockable weapons, and 27 pets that you can unlock. Each new character has a new design, a new magic, and sometimes a new weapon. Weapons are abundant throughout the game, whether you buy them, dig them up, have pets find them, or kill enemies. They also have buffs and debuffs depending on the weapon; for example it might raise your strength and magic but minus your defense. They also have "special abilities" which can do a multitude of things; shock your enemies, set fire to your enemies, increase critical hits on your enemies, etc. Now onto pets; Pets are REALLY cool, just like weapons they can buff you, or debuff you. They also have special abilities, such as; finding buried treasure, defeating enemies at low health, bringing you food, etc. etc. That's about all I have to say about this AMAZING game. I totally recommend that you buy Castle Crashers! I now leave you with the best sidescrolling beatem up to date! BYEEEEE

												Let me tell you a story.Playing this game with 4 friends on Xbox. We were semi good people so we were trying to give one friend the "Kiss all the princesses in a multiplayer game" achievement.  I was the Blue Knight, and had a fairly balanced build between Magic and Damage, with a little bit of health and dex thrown in, and I was using the Bi-Polar Bear animal orb.  The friend getting the achievement was the Orange Knight, and he put every point he earned into magic untill he maxed it out.  No hp or damage or anything.  We had another friend, playing the Fire Demon character and using the Rammy Animal Orb.  Incase you didnt know, rammy will randomly knock people down (I dont remember if it does damage or not).The final boss has just been defeated and now we must fight for the last princess. We planned on letting Orange knight win, but rammy had other plans. The second the fight started Rammy knocked down our Orange knight. I hit him once and because of his build it did more damage than expected and pretty much half healthed him.  I was backing off now, to let him win, but Bi Polar Bear went over and executed Orange knight. He was mad, and I got 15 minuets of straight laughter. 10/10

Consider getting a pack that offers multiple copies

Posted: June 27, 2015
												The game has a really nice art style that totally fits it's theme. STORY : The story is pretty simple, a bunch of princesses and a crystal get kidnapped and stolen.It's up to the 4 knights (or 1 if you don't have any friends) to rescue all of the princesses and return the crystal.While doing it you will make out with all of the princesses ofcourse. Gameplay : The game is a beat-em-up that can be played both, singleplayer and multiplayer.You can perform different combos and shoot with a bow.There is a level system and a stat system in the game. There are 4 types of stats, Strength,Magic,Defense and Agility.It's pretty obvious what those stat's give you but the Agility stat not only makes you move faster but you can also shoot faster with your bow. You can unlock different combos by leveling up and different types of magic by leveling up your magic stat.The game has a pretty high replay value and it has an Insane mode after the normal mode. There are 30+ characters to unlock in various ways.There are also pets ( Animal Orbs ) and 70+ Weapons to find and buy.Cons : The combat can get repetitive and some levels are pretty frustrating if you play with a character that dies easiliy ( Archer/Thief).The DLC characters are totally worth their money and also the money from those DLC' go to charity.The only thing I didn't like are the controls, because it shows the XBOX360 controller buttons and not keyboard buttons.The soundtrack is great too.I give this game a9/10.It's a great game ^.^

Posted: June 22, 2015
												Pros Castle Crashers is a 4 player, local beat em up brawler and is the game most people think of when they play brawlers. i have played Castle Crashers on both PC and Xbox. I rate the game very highly and it is the best of its genre of 4 player brawlers. this game is a great game to play by yourself but it is much more fun with friends and you can meet good people on servers of this game. the game has 2 difficulty modes normal and insane mode, and insane mode is very challenging. If you think hard isn't hard enough you can play the game without spending any level up points making it more challenging and this game is very fun when you set your own goals. the game is full of content with tons of weapons, characters, pets, and other unlock-ables to make the game worth replaying multiple times. the graphics on this game are great, it looks like a beautiful flash game and this version has great options for its sound, display, controls, rebind-able keys, and it has excellent controller support. if you on other games owned by the same company you unlock a playable character in that game example if you own battle block theater you can unlock hatty hattington. Cons The game is kinda short but its not a big problem because its replayable but still, you will get sick of playing the same levels so many times new levels would have fixed this problem  Leveling up to 99 takes too long, previously there were tricks to level up like the boomerang glitch, the 256 glitch, and other tricks but they have been patched and that HUGELY take away from the game, when i had played castle crashers on the xbox 360 the boomerang glitch was partly patched where the exp rewarding glitch would only work in the industrial castle and that made it easier to level up you could really level up fast if you did the trick with insane mode on but sadly that has been patched. in my opinion patching games are really good, game breaking bugs need to be fixed obviously, i had no problem with the 256 glitch being removed, making the boomerang glitch work on only one boss was alright, but i think that taking out makes leveling up stupidly long without out of game cheats. A few of characters use the same ability's example the grey knight and the cone head knight have the exact same magic ability's, and you need to beat the glitch specific characters to unlock other ones. ConclusionOverall its worth it and really enjoyable to play but the level up system needs at least a few more easy ways to level up it takes quite a long time to level up making the game very hard to fully complete. i would recommend a console version over the PC version because the level up system is simply better. i also recommend all the DLC it is worthwhile to pay for the new content, the pink knight DLC is worthwhile and the purple knight DLC is not as interesting as the pink knight DLC mainly because of one weapon (put simply because the broccoli sword is the best starting weapon), but still worth it. Castle Crashers is a must have in my opinion, worth every cent and is the definitive game of its genre.

Posted: April 23, 2015
												Castle Crashers is a game that brings back the fun and excitement of all the flash games that we used to play online. Its hack n' slash gameplay is very well made and gets addictive rapidly. The art style is cartoony and really adds in a sense of humor that just makes the game that much more fun. Along with the vast assortment of weapons and adorable animal companions that can be found throughout the game, there is also an online matchmaking mode that adds a significant amount of replay value. If desired, strangers and friends can fight alongside you and help you complete the main story. Overall, I really enjoyed playing this game. If you want to be generous, consider buying the 4 pack so you and your friends can complete the main story together. This is definitely worth playing.

Posted: December 24, 2015
												Castle Crashers is a completionist's dream: you unlock characters as you play through the game with the ones you start with, and playing through with these unlocked characters grants you even MORE characters, and so forth and so on.  There are even crossovers into Behemoth's other games, most notably Battleblock Theater.  There are also weapons and pets to locate throughout each of the maps, and getting a few of them can be quite a challenge.  The soundtrack is also quite catchy; I find myself humming tunes from it throughout the day.Playing with friends is ideal, but it is possible to play the game solo.  Consider getting a pack that offers multiple copies

Posted: February 7, 2015
												Castle Crashers is a fun game. The gameplay is simple, yet entertaining. Combos become available as you progress your character and each new move fits in nicely with the other mechanics. You level up each character separately which is both tedious and a reason to play even more. There's a decent leveling system and some interesting weapon stats. Each character plays through the story mode separately.The story is really nothing of note. It's the classic "Damsel in Distress" plot and none of your characters really differ from each other besides the element their magic takes the shape of. Most of the humor is juvenile at best and, from my experience, tends to annoy rather than entertain. All the cutscenes are unskippable, which means the game forces you to watch animals take a dump every time you load up that level. It's a good time-waster, but it's unlikely that you'll be able to invest any emotion into the characters or events. I sugest getting it to play with friends. 7/10

Posted: October 24, 2015
												This game is honestly one of my favorite gaming experiences from the last decade.  I grew up playing 2D side-scrolling beat 'em ups in arcades (yes, those still existed in my day), but it has been quite a long time since I've played anything new in that genre.  Enter Castle Crashers.  This game had a ton of hype after its success on consoles, and luckily it lived up to that hype.  Castle Crashers is a beat 'em up with a couple of twists.  It adds combos to the combat system, which mixes things up and adds variety.  In addition the characters level up and have stats that you can put experience points into, as well as you're able to equip different weapons with different stats.  These RPG-like additions mean that you can play the game in different ways (rely on speed, heavy damage, magic, etc.).  This really adds to the game, and ensures that you have a unique experience.  While the story is a bit weak, the overall length of the game and the variation in game levels is phenomenal.  The game even offers a new game+ mode after you beat it.  This game screams multiplayer, but I played it predominantly as a single player due to a lack of friends interested in playing.  While I ran into no problems playing the regular mode as a single player, about halfway through the new game+ mode I found it too difficult to progress.  I suppose I could have grinded my character's level at that point, but instead I chose to start a brand new character and play the game in a different manner this time (I would rely on magic).  Overall this game is a joy, and builds upon and improves on the formula set out by such classics as Double Dragon and Final Fight.  This game is so good that it makes me wonder why it took so long for someone to rejuvenate the beat 'em up genre.  This game is fantastic and I would rate it a 9.5/10.

Posted: March 31, 2016
												If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients:1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie Directions:1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Posted: January 4, 2015
												Castle Crashers is a good ol' fashion beat 'em up with small twerks like magic and other things.A good idea is to not play alone, even another person with you will make the game more fun and easier. Another nice feature is having pets, pets give you a boost in something whether it be agility and damage, defense, increased xp gain, etc. Everytime you level up you gain 2-1 skill points but sadly its not a skill tree function. Instead you upgrade 4 stats, Strength, Magic, Defense, and Agility.I'd like to also point out the interesting art style that makes all the colors easier to see and more vibrant even though it is such a simple one.I have gotten into a bit of the game myself but I haven't beaten it yet but I shall reveal a small bit of the story.The story follows you/the knight you chose, and while you are rocking out in a castle a large scale invasion has happened by an orcish like creature and the 4 princess are captured. It's up to you and 1-3 other friends to rescue the princesses. Pets, level ups, new weapons, and gold will help you along your way.If you do decied to buy this game (It's 14.99 on steam store) I hope this review helped your choice!I rate this game 9.5/10

Posted: February 7, 2015
												Castle Crashers is a fun game. The gameplay is simple, yet entertaining. Combos become available as you progress your character and each new move fits in nicely with the other mechanics. You level up each character separately which is both tedious and a reason to play even more. There's a decent leveling system and some interesting weapon stats. Each character plays through the story mode separately.The story is really nothing of note. It's the classic "Damsel in Distress" plot and none of your characters really differ from each other besides the element their magic takes the shape of. Most of the humor is juvenile at best and, from my experience, tends to annoy rather than entertain. All the cutscenes are unskippable, which means the game forces you to watch animals take a dump every time you load up that level. It's a good time-waster, but it's unlikely that you'll be able to invest any emotion into the characters or events. I sugest getting it to play with friends. 7/10

Posted: July 24, 2014
												Before I reveiw this game i'd like to give some backround as how I came across this gem I first heard of this game when a well known youtube channel called "Game Grumps" started playing it on there show steam train and I fell in love with this game and I knew I had to get it so I decided to get this game along with a few extra copies for a few of my friends and this game is an absolute blast Castle Crashers was originally realesed in 2008 later getting a steam port in 2012 Castle crashers is a 2-D beat-em up with some Rpg elements thrown in such as leveling up stats yet what sets this game apart from the standered beat-em up is 3 things the art style the music and its amazing humor the art style is very simplistic and colorful and it fits perfectly with the games over the top humor the music is truly something to behold an interesting thing is that the games music was made by people submitting there music creations on the flash site Newgrounds and lets just say it did not dissapoint the music seems to fit in so well with every situation in the game my personal favorite peice being Simple Sight by "Real Fraction" or the music when you fight the necromancer it really gets you pumped for a fight the games online is nearly flawless yet I wish the game would make it so it would make so the other players that join you would be the same or close to the same level as you  but thats just a minor nitpick i'd say that castle crashers has become one of my biggest gaming guilty pleasures and is well worth a second playthrough the game has great replay value and playing through the entire game from start to finish with one of my best friends is an expeirence I shall not forget I think that Castle crashers is a instant classic and deserves to be as popular as it is I highly recommend it

Posted: December 26, 2014
Castle Crashers was really fun. Really, really fun. For a simple hack-and-slash game, it's actually very impresive that Castle Crashers did not get stale, repetitive, or boring during the entire time I played it. Maybe it's because of the game's many, many unlockables. Maybe it's because of the gameplay's excellent execution. Maybe it's because of the kooky sense of style that permeates the entire experience.Developed by the Behemoth, Castle Crashers opens with your character (or characters, if you're playing co-op) dancing to the worst tavern music ever concieved, only for the party to be cut off by a lone knight, who tumbles through the door riddled with arrows and proceeds to die immediately. You go out to see what's up, only to discover that your castle is under seige and the four princesses have been captured!Thus begins one wild ride, with increasingly impressive boss fights and set pieces, all with a sly sense of humor. You'll fight your way through the land, searching for each princess, slaying fearsome beasts, and accomplishing great acts of derring-do.One of the most memorable and entertaining sequences has you crashing a wedding to save the Green Princess, only for her to be kidnapped again (by a mechanical cyclops, no less) and taken away. Not if you can help it! Your characters jump out of a window to land on top of the horse-drawn carriage carting the princess off. There, you engage in thrilling combat with several of the cyclops' cronies. But wait! During the battle, a humongous troll with laser vision begins chasing the carriage, gunning for you!I won't tell you how that ends, but rest assured, the entire game is epic and hilarious. There's a large variety of enemies, some easier to fight than others, and your strengths and weaknesses will be determined by how you choose to level up your character. The bosses are all carried out on the grandest of scales, and each one brings a different challenge to the table. The world is expansive and filled with interesting locales. There are tons of weapons hidden throughout the game, and players going back through some of the levels to explore will be well rewarded.Castle Crashers is an excellent entry in the Behemoth's game catalogue, and it delights from start to finish.9 out of 10.

												Ok so  you remember those games you used to play when you were young? the ones you had to Head to the arcade to play, the beat-up games. Ok so you remember those games you play now. the ones where you can pick what you look like and edit you stats to your play style. Ok so you try to imagine a game like this, your young yearsm your teens years, your now. when you imagine this game you will get Castle crashers, a beat-up game where you play with your friends to defeat all the enemys and do a puzzle in order to continue and edit your looks and stats to your play style. Because to me, thats what Castle Crashers is, your childhood, your teenhood, and your now-hood.

Posted: June 26, 2014
												This game is awesome! It has a great sense of humor, though things are still epic and serious. There are many characters to unlock which is always a good thing, and the pets are adorable (well, some of them, anyway o.o). The only cons is that it can, in fact, get boring after a while, but the fun can last forever if you're playing with a good friend. Talking about friends, the Online Multiplayer in this is pretty bad, not gonna lie. But I'll admit that that's because of some people's internet (not everyone's internet can be as fast as mine~).Overall, this game has many pros and very little cons, so I really recommend it. Posted: January 11, 2014
												Castle crashers is fun side-scrolling beat-em-up game with some crude humor. There are about 30 characters and around 80 weapons to use, each with their own magical abilities and different stats. At first, you only have 4 characters to choose from, but as you progress, you can unlock more and characters by winning arena matches or defeating certain levels. The story is very simple, but the gameplay is so much fun, that you don't even mind. As you start, you don't have many attacks, but as you level up and raise your stats, more combos and magic abilities will be unlocked. For me, grinding for levels was never really an issue, becuase your fighting most of the time anyways. As you progress in the game, you can find tiny animals that float around called "Animal Orbs". Animals orbs can give you different abilities that help you in battle such as raising you stats or being able to level up faster. There are also shops where you can buy more weapons, animal orbs, bombs and health potions. The online multi-player mode is very fun, but sometimes lagged for me. Although that might be just my computer. Just like other beat-em-up games, their are bosses and different enemy  types as well. Unfourtunaly, there are some glitches, but it is'nt a huge issue. Before you consider buying this game, make sure you have a controller compadable with steam, because playing this game with a key board is just imposible. In my opinion, this game is awesome. I've aready finished the game twice, so if you like beat-em-ups, I recomend you atleast play it once.

Posted: August 10, 2015
												Castle Crashers is a competitive co-op beat-em-up by the minds behind Alien Hominid. You and three friends travel throughout the kingdom ruining lives and crashing castles on your stubborn quest to save the princesses. There are tons of landscapes to traverse, weapons and characters to unlock, and princesses to kiss. You can even gain experience and level up your chosen knight. This has to be the best beat-em-up I've played in a long time, even coming close to beating Scott Pilgrim as my favorite. A great time alone, and even better with friends, Castle Crashers isn't getting outta here without a recommendation.

Posted: July 11, 2016
												Possibly the best multiplayer game I've ever played.The gameplay is incredibly fun and fast-paced, the combos are satisfying, there are multiple different character builds you can make using the level-up system, and there are  tons  of unlockables, such as new characters with different move sets, new weapons with different stats and special effects, and animal orbs (essentially pets) granting you lots of different bonuses, from increasing your character's strength, through ramming down enemies, to pecking away at knocked down enemies.The remastered edition (the edition available on steam) re-balanced lots of weapon and animal orb stats, and added a new mode called "Back Off Barbarian", in which you escape from constantly spawning enemies and get a rating based on the time you managed to survive.Although the game is intended to be played in co-op, it's perfectly playable and enjoyable in singleplayer.The game's controls work very well with a gamepad, but with some rebinding, can also be quite good on a keyboard.The only larger flaw the game has, in my opinion, is the lack of randomly generated levels and enemies, which would add a lot to the replay value. However, the game is still very replayable thanks to tons of hidden content, such as weapons or animal orbs, making you discover something new every run.The game's soundtrack is fantastic as well, with each area having a very fitting and enjoyable track.The game's art style might seem basic to some, but actually works very well with the game's gameplay and feel.Overall, the steam edition of Castle Crashers is a solid 8.5/10 for me. Would recommend to nearly everyone, even if multiplayer isn't necessarily your thing.tl;dr: The game is very, very good. Buy it. Worth it even at full price.

Consider getting a pack that offers multiple copies

Posted: October 24, 2015
												This game is honestly one of my favorite gaming experiences from the last decade.  I grew up playing 2D side-scrolling beat 'em ups in arcades (yes, those still existed in my day), but it has been quite a long time since I've played anything new in that genre.  Enter Castle Crashers.  This game had a ton of hype after its success on consoles, and luckily it lived up to that hype.  Castle Crashers is a beat 'em up with a couple of twists.  It adds combos to the combat system, which mixes things up and adds variety.  In addition the characters level up and have stats that you can put experience points into, as well as you're able to equip different weapons with different stats.  These RPG-like additions mean that you can play the game in different ways (rely on speed, heavy damage, magic, etc.).  This really adds to the game, and ensures that you have a unique experience.  While the story is a bit weak, the overall length of the game and the variation in game levels is phenomenal.  The game even offers a new game+ mode after you beat it.  This game screams multiplayer, but I played it predominantly as a single player due to a lack of friends interested in playing.  While I ran into no problems playing the regular mode as a single player, about halfway through the new game+ mode I found it too difficult to progress.  I suppose I could have grinded my character's level at that point, but instead I chose to start a brand new character and play the game in a different manner this time (I would rely on magic).  Overall this game is a joy, and builds upon and improves on the formula set out by such classics as Double Dragon and Final Fight.  This game is so good that it makes me wonder why it took so long for someone to rejuvenate the beat 'em up genre.  This game is fantastic and I would rate it a 9.5/10.

Posted: July 13, 2015
												I love this game, if you haven't played it, it's best to try and play it with others who also haven't tried it yet. Going through it your first time as a group is extremely fun. It's fairly simple and short, but highly replayable, and the little cinematics remain enjoyable, and you may notice something you didn't before while doing another playthrough. It is a pretty button mashy beat-em-up, so if you want gameplay with a lot of variety, this may not be the best choice, Otherwise, hitting x a bunch of times and juggling enemies in the air from one side of the screen to the other remains fun. My only issue is the experience system. You get experience for hitting enemies (except when they've died and you're not letting their corpses rest peacefully), regardless of damage. If you are stronger than the other players, you will level up slower. This sort of inhibits magic users from leveling decently, since you deal high damage in few hits.If you look at the negative reviews, most of them are people complaining that the game is unplayable on keyboard. I first played the game on Xbox, loved it, eventually got it on PC and still loved it. Recently the A button on my controller got jammed after hours of a little game called Ys Origin...so now I use the keyboard. Guess what? I'm completely fine, the game is still entirely playable, fun, and not really any harder. The people complaining probably just suck...ignore them. The instructions do only show Xbox controls, making you have to test to figure out the controls, but you can map the keys you want to use anyway.

Posted: June 14, 2016
												It is an old game but since i primarily game on a laptop I'm always looking for good games that can run on my system.Castle Crashers looks really good, play really well. The controls are easy to use both on the keyboard and xbox controller (although i keep accidently using my items from the tiny inventory) so this is great to play with friends with little or no gaming experience. Theres tons of weapons and all the upgradable character abilities are equally important which makes it a challenge to prioritize your skill points. The game is a good balance of difficulty, not too hard or too easy and theres a wide variety of enemies and bosses in an art style i really dig. After completing the game the first time round, Castle Crashers still has more to give. The addition of insane mode and secrets all over the map like weapons to dig up and animal orbs in the store makes sure you never get tired of this game. Very worth my money. Get it if you're bored, get it if you have friends coming over, get it if you haven't.

												Amaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaazing! Ive Played Castle Crashers Before On My Friends XBox 360 I Loved It! And Wished I Could Get It! Then I Saw It On Steam :D I Was So Exited To Get It! I Didnt Have Any Money Though... So I Added It To My Wishlist And Then A Few Months Later It Was Secret Santa At my School The Person Who Got Me Gave Me A 20 Dollar Steam Gift Card! And The Second The Steam Winter Sale Started I Rushed To The Store To Get It! Got The Portal Bundle For Only 5 Bucks! And Castle Crashers For Me And My Friend And We Played It That Night! So Yes I Do Reccomend This Game BUT! Wait For A sale This Game Is A Bit Pricey! But Other Then That Perfect! 5 Stars! :)

Posted: June 24, 2016
												Jogo muito bem feito, que roda em qualquer torradeira sem placa de vídeo (tipo a minha) a pelo menos 30 fps, não exige internet potente pra jogar online e bem...sobre, o jogo mesmo...10/10- Uma ♥♥♥♥♥da de cavaleiros diferentes- É difícil zerar sozinho na primeira vez, o que pode incentivar um co-op dos brother- Humor de bosta (literalmente)- DLC's tem um preço aceitável, mas que não afetam em absolutamente nada a gameplay (como uma verdadeira DLC deve ser)- Diversos combos que você pode fazer com personagens e armas diferentes (fora os pets que sempre buffam alguma coisa dos seus atributos)- Acho que o único ponto negativo é a falta de comunicação com pessoas online, caso decida achar alguém aleatório pra jogar online. Fora isso, continua 10/10Recomendado pra qualquer um que tenha dinheiro sobrando na carteira ou esteja procurando por um jogo divertido em promoções.

Posted: May 4, 2016
												A port of the XBLA original, Castle Crashers will take you across a hand-drawn journey with four other players on your side. Beat up hoards of baddies and fight for the princess's kiss. The music was created by the Newgrounds community and gives the game a distinct touch. A crazy amount of unlockable characters are ready to be found, leading to countless hours of content to help grind up your knight.

Posted: December 23, 2014
												Have you ever wanted:To go on a quest to save a crystal and some damsel's in distress with friends?To beat your friends in an eating contest, but never could do it IRL?To challenge your friends for a kiss from a damsel you have saved?To have an adorable creature help you on this adventure?To walk around with a lollipop as a weapon?Spam kill enemies into a wall, and to have it never stop to where your friends wish you would stop?Steal the money/food/animal your friend was about to grab?Well look no further, this game is for you.Disclaimer: May lose your friends due to competitiveness, as well as screwing them over for some of the achievements in the game.

Posted: October 6, 2012
												I've wanted this game for a while, but didn't own an Xbox even though I've played it and thoroughly enjoyed it before.  Looking around on forums people are complaining about the price being the same as it was four years ago with no DLCs included, and being a lazy portover but I don't mind too much since I already use a 360 controller with other games.  It just depends if you want to play it on PC is all.  Hours and hours of fun, totally worth it IMO, won't need to wait for the sales really...One thing of note is that multiplayer is peer-to-peer, unlike other Behemoth games like Battleblock Theater which seem to use servers. If your or your friends' connections are weak (like mine), expect a lot of sync lag to add to your play time.

Posted: April 14, 2016
												This game has been a favorite of mine for quite some time. I've had it on the PS3 for a long time, however, I wanted to try it out on the PC. The text, imo, is so much nicer and it overall is a better, more fun experience. If you aren't sure whether your computer can handle the game, there is always the demo, which most games seem to not have. Recommended buy!
